name: Windows vs Unix line ending mismatch
description: LLM produces Unix line endings but file has Windows line endings
original:
#!/bin/bash

set -e

echo "Starting deployment..."

if [ -z "$ENVIRONMENT" ]; then
    echo "Error: ENVIRONMENT not set"
    exit 1
fi

echo "Deploying to $ENVIRONMENT"

llm_edit.old_text:
if [ -z "$ENVIRONMENT" ]; then
    echo "Error: ENVIRONMENT not set"
    exit 1
fi
llm_edit.new_text:
if [ -z "$ENVIRONMENT" ]; then
    echo "Error: ENVIRONMENT not set"
    exit 1
fi

if [ -z "$VERSION" ]; then
    echo "Error: VERSION not set"
    exit 1
fi

expected:
#!/bin/bash

set -e

echo "Starting deployment..."

if [ -z "$ENVIRONMENT" ]; then
    echo "Error: ENVIRONMENT not set"
    exit 1
fi

if [ -z "$VERSION" ]; then
    echo "Error: VERSION not set"
    exit 1
fi

echo "Deploying to $ENVIRONMENT"

metadata.failure_reason: LLM search pattern uses \n but file has \r\n line endings
